heading: HB05110
0: AN ACT PROHIBITING INTERNET SHOPS FROM ADMITTING ELEMENTARY AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH THE INTENT TO PLAY ON-LINE/VIDEO GAMES DURING SCHOOL HOURS AND PRESCRIBING PENALTIES FOR VIOLATION THEREOF AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
short-title: Elementary And High School Students' On-line / Video Game Ban Act
status: Pending with the Committee on BASIC EDUCATION AND CULTURE since 2017-02-28
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB05110
FULL TITLE : AN ACT PROHIBITING INTERNET SHOPS FROM ADMITTING ELEMENTARY AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WITH THE INTENT TO PLAY ON-LINE/VIDEO GAMES DURING SCHOOL HOURS AND PRESCRIBING PENALTIES FOR VIOLATION THEREOF AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
SHORT TITLE : Elementary And High School Students' On-line / Video Game Ban Act
ABSTRACT : Restricts the access of the above-mentioned students to on-line games in Internet shops/cafes during school hours, provided that these student seeking admission INTEND to play any on-line/video game.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : CASTELO, WINSTON "WINNIE"
DATE FILED : 2017-02-22
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Violago (002 2017-07-25)2. Cagas (000 2018-01-09)
3. Malapitan (000 2018-01-09)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON BASIC EDUCATION AND CULTURE ON 2017-02-28
